diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +29,33 @@If your project uses Scala.js, replace the double-`%` with a triple.  Note that **cats-effect** has an upstream dependency on **cats-core** version 1.x.

Cross-builds are available for Scala 2.11.x, 2.12.x, and 2.13.0-RC2, as well as Scala.js 0.6.x. Version 2.0.0-M2 has been cross-built for 2.13.0-RC2 and depends upon cats-core version 2.x.

The most current snapshot (or major release) can be found in the maven badge at the top of this readme.  If you are a very brave sort, you are free to depend on snapshots; they are stable versions, as they are derived from the git hash rather than an unstable `-SNAPSHOT` suffix, but they do not come with any particular confidence or compatibility guarantees.

comments.body:
Linebacker as currently defined will be superseded by #289.

@ChristopherDavenport should chime in on whether he still wants to provide Linebacker with extra utilities or not afterwards.

@alexandru I think `linebacker` still does a bit more than just `ContextShift.evalOn`. Eg. provides different `ExecutionContext`s based on the type of work the user needs to perform. In addition, I think it works for the `0.10.x` series? In that case, I think it's worth keeping it in the list but I'll leave the final word to @ChristopherDavenport .

N.B. you cannot keep compatibility with Cats-Effect 0.10 unless you effectively maintain two projects.

I have no objections to keeping it in the list if @ChristopherDavenport continues maintaining it for 1.0.

I can certainly keep it active for 1.0 for ease of use and transitions reasons. That said `evalOn` will likely be all that is necessary for upstream libraries so it will likely only be for user apps ease of access I would imagine.

So I really don't need to continue it, but if there is a desire for the naming conventions it introduces I can keep it around.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +80,84 @@| [Console4cats](https://gvolpe.github.io/console4cats/) | Console I/O for Cats Effect |
| [Fuuid](https://christopherdavenport.github.io/fuuid/) | Functional UUID's |
| [Linebacker](https://christopherdavenport.github.io/linebacker/) | Thread Pool Management for Scala: Enabling functional blocking where needed |
| [Log4cats](https://christopherdavenport.github.io/log4cats/) | Functional Logging |
